quiz.title: Physics 11: Unit 5 Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: Rotational Motion: Circular Kinematics & Dynamics
quiz.subject: Physics 11
quiz.topic: Angular & Tangential Quantities, Centripetal Force & Acceleration

questions.question: A car rounds a circular curve of radius 50.0 m. If it completes a quarter of the circle (π/2 radians) in 5.00 seconds, what is its tangential speed?
questions.explanation: Arc length s = rθ = 50.0 m × (π/2) ≈ 78.54 m. Tangential speed v = s/t = 78.54 m / 5.00 s ≈ 15.7 m/s.

questions.question: A 0.250 kg ball is attached to a 1.20 m string and swung in a horizontal circle. It completes 10.0 revolutions in 8.00 seconds. What is the centripetal force acting on the ball?
questions.explanation: First find angular velocity ω: 10 rev / 8 s = 1.25 rev/s. Converting to rad/s: ω = 1.25 × 2π ≈ 7.854 rad/s. Force F_c = mω²r = 0.250 × (7.854)² × 1.20 ≈ 18.5 N.

questions.question: A bicycle wheel makes 120 revolutions while slowing down. What is its angular displacement in radians?
questions.explanation: One revolution is 2π radians. Therefore, 120 revolutions = 120 × 2π = 240π rad.

questions.question: A disc starts from rest and rotates with a constant angular acceleration of 2.00 rad/s². What is its angular velocity after it has turned through 100 radians?
A car's tire of radius 0.300 m rotates at 1500 revolutions per minute (rpm). What is the tangential speed of a point on its rim?
A satellite is in a circular orbit with a period of 90.0 minutes (5400 s). If the centripetal acceleration is 8.50 m/s², what is the radius of its orbit? (Use π = 3.14)
A Ferris wheel with a radius of 15.0 m completes one revolution every 40.0 seconds. What is the centripetal acceleration of a rider?
A particle moves in a circle. If its tangential acceleration is 3.00 m/s² and its centripetal acceleration is 4.00 m/s², what is the magnitude of its total acceleration?
A wheel accelerates uniformly from 10.0 rad/s to 30.0 rad/s over 5.00 seconds. Through what angular displacement does it turn?
questions.explanation: Average ω = (10 + 30) / 2 = 20 rad/s. Displacement θ = ω_avg × t = 20 rad/s × 5.00 s = 100 rad.

questions.question: A car drives over a circular hill crest of radius 70.0 m. What is the maximum speed it can have without losing contact with the road? (Use g = 9.80 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Contact is lost when Normal Force = 0, so mg = mv²/r. v = √(gr) = √(9.80 × 70.0) = 26.2 m/s.

scoreMessages.50: Good start. Focus on the relationship between linear and angular velocity (v = ωr).
